com.gembox.spreadsheet.conditionalformatting

Class AboveOrBelowAverageCondition

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gembox.spreadsheet.conditionalformatting.FormatCondition
      • com.gembox.spreadsheet.conditionalformatting.AboveOrBelowAverageCondition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.gembox.spreadsheet.internal.styles.CellFormatDataFormatHolder

    public final class AboveOrBelowAverageCondition
extends FormatCondition
    Represents a condition that formats only cells with values that are above or below average.
    See Also:
    Excel Conditional Formatting example

      • getConditionType

        public FormatConditionType getConditionType()
        Gets the FormatConditionType.ABOVE_OR_BELOW_AVERAGE value.
        Specified by:
        getConditionType in class FormatCondition
        Returns:
        The FormatConditionType.ABOVE_OR_BELOW_AVERAGE value.

      • getStandardDeviations

        public int getStandardDeviations()

        Gets the number of standard deviations above or below average.

        Only cells with values above or below average ± (standard deviations) * std are formatted.

        Default value is 0.

        Returns:
        The number of standard deviations above or below average.
        See Also:
        Standard deviation (std)

      • getStyle

        public CellStyle getStyle()
        Gets the actual formatting which will be applied to a cell if its value satisfies this AboveOrBelowAverageCondition.
        Returns:
        The actual formatting which will be applied to a cell if its value satisfies this AboveOrBelowAverageCondition.

      • isBelow

        public boolean isBelow()

        Gets a value indicating whether to format cells with values below average.

        Default value is false (formats cells with values above average).

        Returns:
        true to format cells with values below average; otherwise, false.

      • isEqual

        public boolean isEqual()

        Gets a value indicating whether to format cells with values equal to average.

        Default value is false (formats cells with values exclusively above or below average).

        Returns:
        true to format cells with values equal to average; otherwise, false.

      • setBelow

        public void setBelow(boolean below)

        Sets a value indicating whether to format cells with values below average.

        Default value is false (formats cells with values above average).

        Parameters:
        below - true to format cells with values below average; otherwise, false.

      • setEqual

        public void setEqual(boolean equal)

        Sets a value indicating whether to format cells with values equal to average.

        Default value is false (formats cells with values exclusively above or below average).

        Parameters:
        equal - true to format cells with values equal to average; otherwise, false.

      • setStandardDeviations

        public void setStandardDeviations(int standardDeviations)

        Sets the number of standard deviations above or below average.

        Only cells with values above or below average ± (standard deviations) * std are formatted.

        Default value is 0.

        Parameters:
        standardDeviations - The number of standard deviations above or below average.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Value is less than zero.
        See Also:
        Standard deviation (std)

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a String that represents this AboveOrBelowAverageCondition instance.

        This method should be used primarily for debugging purposes and should be considered volatile (format of its return value might change in future versions).

        Specified by:
        toString in class FormatCondition
        Returns:
        A String that represents this AboveOrBelowAverageCondition instance.
